title: Division
text: Remember that $$\frac{f}{g}$$ is the same as $$\frac{f}{g} x$$. All we have to do is divide the two functions.

title: Division
text: Since these functions are fractions, we need to keep, change, and switch to divide them. We keep $$\frac{1}{x-4}$$ the same, change the division to muliplication, and switch $$\frac{1}{6-x}$$ to $$\frac{6-x}{1}$$.

title: Division
text: We now multiply the numerators and denominators together. $$1\left(6-x\right)=6-x$$, and $$1\left(x-4\right)=x-4$$. So, the final answer is $$\frac{6-x}{x-4}$$.
speech: We now multiply the numerators and denominators together.  1 times, parentheses 6 minus x,  is equal to 6 minus x , and , 1 times, parentheses x minus 4,  is equal to x minus 4 . So, the final answer is  fraction, 6 minus x, over, x minus 4,  .
